title: Alibates Flint Quarries National Monument: Permits & Reservations
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Permits & Reservations              Permits & Reservations       At Alibates Flint Quarries National Monument, reservations and permits are required for a few types of activities. Scroll down to read more.         Quarry Tours You may visit the quarry sites by ranger-guided tour only. During the winter/spring of 2015, tours are on Saturdays at 10 a.m. and 2 p.m., as weather and staffing allows. Please call ahead to check availability and confirm tour times.  Quarry tours typically take 1.5-2 hours and involve a moderate one-mile round trip hike. The trail to the quarries is covered in loose gravel and includes stairs. You will gain approximately 170 feet of elevation as you hike up to the quarry sites. Bring water and wear comfortable, sturdy, closed-toe walking shoes or hiking boots. It is often very windy up on the mesa, so a jacket is recommended. You might also bring sunscreen, a hat, and a walking stick. Please Note: This hiking tour is not recommended to visitors with health conditions including heart problems, breathing problems or artificial knees/hips.           A hike up to the Alibates Flint Quarries involves climbing a set of stairs equivalent to a 17-story building. NPS Photo        Special Permits: Group activities of more than 15 visitors such as family reunions, company picnics and group campouts require special permits.
